title: Chinese Embassy donates funds and materials to Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage in Djibouti in August 2020
description: On August 12, 2020, the Chinese Embassy donated funds and materials to the Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage in Djibouti. The materials included various home appliances, computers, and other equipment. These materials will help the orphanage create a good environment and provide opportunities for full development. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony for this donation was held at the Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage. China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, Zhuo Ruisheng, officials from the Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage, the Minister of Women and Family, the Dean of Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage, and others attended the ceremony. Ambassador Zhuo and Minister Hassan jointly signed the handover certificate.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates funds and materials to Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage in Djibouti in August 2020

# Description
On August 12, 2020, the Chinese Embassy donated funds and materials to the Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage in Djibouti. The materials included various home appliances, computers, and other equipment. These materials will help the orphanage create a good environment and provide opportunities for full development. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony for this donation was held at the Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage. China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, Zhuo Ruisheng, officials from the Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage, the Minister of Women and Family, the Dean of Pouponnière Daryel Orphanage, and others attended the ceremony. Ambassador Zhuo and Minister Hassan jointly signed the handover certificate.
justification: Project is a social welfare initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation to orphanage, focus on social development and welfare

title: Chinese government donates anti-epidemic materials to Djibouti in May 2020
description: On May 11, 2020, the Chinese government donated anti-epidemic materials to Djibouti. These materials will be used to improve COVID-19 prevention efforts in Djibouti. The specific type, amount, and monetary value of this donation are unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Djibouti-Ambouli International Airport. China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, Zhuo Ruisheng, the Foreign Minister of Djibouti, and the Health Minister of Djibouti attended the ceremony. Ambassador Zhuo and Foreign Minister Yusuf signed the handover certificate on behalf of their respective governments.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description
On May 11, 2020, the Chinese government donated anti-epidemic materials to Djibouti. These materials will be used to improve COVID-19 prevention efforts in Djibouti. The specific type, amount, and monetary value of this donation are unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Djibouti-Ambouli International Airport. China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, Zhuo Ruisheng, the Foreign Minister of Djibouti, and the Health Minister of Djibouti attended the ceremony. Ambassador Zhuo and Foreign Minister Yusuf signed the handover certificate on behalf of their respective governments.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare and epidemic prevention without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic materials for COVID-19 prevention, healthcare focus

title: China Merchants Group donates anti-epidemic materials to Djibouti in April 2020
description: On April 7, 2020, the China Merchants Group donated anti-epidemic materials to Djibouti. The materials included medical masks, protective clothing, goggles, fluorescent quantitative PCR instruments, and visible infrared thermometers. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, Zhuo Ruisheng, the Minister of Health of Djibouti, the Secretary-General of the Ministry of Health, the Chairman of the Port and Free Trade Zone Authority, and the Chief Representative of China Merchants Group in Djibouti attended the ceremony.

title: 20th Chinese Medical Team Dispatched to Djibouti
description: On November 14, 2020, the 20th Chinese Medical Team arrived in Djibouti. The team was made up of 9 doctors from Shanxi Provincial People's Hospital and was stationed at General Peltier Hospital. The team departed on November 18th, 2021. During their time in Djibouti, the team performed 10,954 outpatient and emergency consultations, admitted 595 hospitalized patients, performed 1,792 surgical operations and 436 anesthesia operations, saved 72 patients in critical condition, treated 8,205 patients with traditional Chinese medicine. The team received medals for their service during the pandemic from Prime Minister Abdoulkader Kamil Mohamed.   Since 1981, Shanxi Province has sent medical teams to Djibouti as a foreign aid initiative.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
20th Chinese Medical Team Dispatched to Djibouti

# Description
On November 14, 2020, the 20th Chinese Medical Team arrived in Djibouti. The team was made up of 9 doctors from Shanxi Provincial People's Hospital and was stationed at General Peltier Hospital. The team departed on November 18th, 2021. During their time in Djibouti, the team performed 10,954 outpatient and emergency consultations, admitted 595 hospitalized patients, performed 1,792 surgical operations and 436 anesthesia operations, saved 72 patients in critical condition, treated 8,205 patients with traditional Chinese medicine. The team received medals for their service during the pandemic from Prime Minister Abdoulkader Kamil Mohamed.   Since 1981, Shanxi Province has sent medical teams to Djibouti as a foreign aid initiative.
justification: Project is a healthcare initiative without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team providing healthcare services, no energy or infrastructure components mentioned

title: China Eximbank suspends debt service payments from Government of Djibouti in 2020
description: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting that took place on April 15, 2020, and on November 13, 2020, the Chinese Government agreed to work with other G20 members to implement the Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). Then, in 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of Djibouti signed a debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due in 2020 under one or more loan agreements.
staff_comments: 1. It is unclear why the DSSI debt service deferral data published by the World Bank (https://datatopics.worldbank.org/dssitables/deferrals/annual/DJI) do not identify any debt service deferrals from Chinese creditors. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
China Eximbank suspends debt service payments from Government of Djibouti in 2020

# Description
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting that took place on April 15, 2020, and on November 13, 2020, the Chinese Government agreed to work with other G20 members to implement the Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). Then, in 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of Djibouti signed a debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due in 2020 under one or more loan agreements.
justification: Debt service suspension agreement is a financial arrangement without direct environmental impact
evidence: Debt Service Suspension Initiative, financial agreement between China Eximbank and Government of Djibouti

title: China donates ventilators and thermometers to Dominca for COVID-19 relief
description: On April 17, 2020 the Chinese Embassy in Dominica handed over a donation of medical supplies consisting of 15 non-invasive ventilators in addition to forehead scanner thermometers to Dominica to aid in the fight against the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The handover ceremony was held at the China-Dominica Friendship Hospital in Roseau. In attendance were Dominican officials Reginald Austrie, Senior Minister and Minister of Housing and Urban Development;  Irving McIntyre, Minister of Health; and Kenneth Darroux, Minister of Foreign Affairs. Also in attendance was Chinese Embassy Counsellor, Luo Songtao. During the handover ceremony, Dominica’s Health Minister Dr. Irving McIntyre said non- invasive ventilators are used globally to manage mild to moderate cases of COVID-19, and can also be used to handle other diseases like asthma.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates ventilators and thermometers to Dominca for COVID-19 relief

# Description
On April 17, 2020 the Chinese Embassy in Dominica handed over a donation of medical supplies consisting of 15 non-invasive ventilators in addition to forehead scanner thermometers to Dominica to aid in the fight against the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The handover ceremony was held at the China-Dominica Friendship Hospital in Roseau. In attendance were Dominican officials Reginald Austrie, Senior Minister and Minister of Housing and Urban Development;  Irving McIntyre, Minister of Health; and Kenneth Darroux, Minister of Foreign Affairs. Also in attendance was Chinese Embassy Counsellor, Luo Songtao. During the handover ceremony, Dominica’s Health Minister Dr. Irving McIntyre said non- invasive ventilators are used globally to manage mild to moderate cases of COVID-19, and can also be used to handle other diseases like asthma.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and COVID-19 relief, with no direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation of medical supplies (ventilators and thermometers) for COVID-19 response, healthcare focus

title: China sends the first medical team of the fifth phase of medical support to Dominica (linked to #73211)
description: On October 1, 2020, a medical team from China arrived in Dominica as the first team of the fifth phase of the China-aided medical service cooperation project in Dominica. The team was composed of four doctors selected by the Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University in Guangdong. The doctors were to be posted in Dominica for a one year term of service at the China-Dominica Friendship Hospital. While stationed in Dominica, the team was to provide medical assistance, hold lectures on Coronavirus prevention, and work with the Chinese embassy on vaccine rollout. The team was lead by Dr. Wang Zhiqiang, deputy chief physician of Sun Yat-sen University Cancer Prevention and Control Center.  The doctors returned to Guangdong on October 7th, 2021.   The previous team had left Dominica on July 11, 2020. The umbrella project for all phases of the medical team project in Dominica is #73211.   By September 2022, the fifth team of the fifth phase of the project was set to take off to Dominica.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends the first medical team of the fifth phase of medical support to Dominica (linked to #73211)

# Description
On October 1, 2020, a medical team from China arrived in Dominica as the first team of the fifth phase of the China-aided medical service cooperation project in Dominica. The team was composed of four doctors selected by the Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University in Guangdong. The doctors were to be posted in Dominica for a one year term of service at the China-Dominica Friendship Hospital. While stationed in Dominica, the team was to provide medical assistance, hold lectures on Coronavirus prevention, and work with the Chinese embassy on vaccine rollout. The team was lead by Dr. Wang Zhiqiang, deputy chief physician of Sun Yat-sen University Cancer Prevention and Control Center.  The doctors returned to Guangdong on October 7th, 2021.   The previous team had left Dominica on July 11, 2020. The umbrella project for all phases of the medical team project in Dominica is #73211.   By September 2022, the fifth team of the fifth phase of the project was set to take off to Dominica.
justification: Project focuses on medical assistance and healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team providing healthcare services, Coronavirus prevention lectures, vaccine rollout assistance

title: National Health Commission of China donates medical equipment worth CNY 573,700 to China-Dominica Friendship Hospital
description: On March 13, 2020, a ceremony commemorating a donation from the National Health Commission of China to the Ministry of Health of Dominica was held at the China-Dominica Friendship Hospital in Roseau. Wang Quanhuo, head of the Chinese Embassy's Economic and Commercial Office, ​​and Leticia Lestrate-Wyke, the permanent secretary of the Dominican Ministry of Health, signed the donation handover certificate. Equipment donated included 24-hour ambulatory ECG monitors, 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure monitors, a full digital color Puller ultrasound diagnostic system, wireless full digital ultrasound imaging diagnostic instrument, laparoscopic needle holders, Conkey laparoscopic forceps and clips, portable slit lamps, and laser diagnostic mirrors. According to the Chinese Embassy, the donation was worth 573,700 yuan.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
National Health Commission of China donates medical equipment worth CNY 573,700 to China-Dominica Friendship Hospital

# Description
On March 13, 2020, a ceremony commemorating a donation from the National Health Commission of China to the Ministry of Health of Dominica was held at the China-Dominica Friendship Hospital in Roseau. Wang Quanhuo, head of the Chinese Embassy's Economic and Commercial Office, ​​and Leticia Lestrate-Wyke, the permanent secretary of the Dominican Ministry of Health, signed the donation handover certificate. Equipment donated included 24-hour ambulatory ECG monitors, 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure monitors, a full digital color Puller ultrasound diagnostic system, wireless full digital ultrasound imaging diagnostic instrument, laparoscopic needle holders, Conkey laparoscopic forceps and clips, portable slit lamps, and laser diagnostic mirrors. According to the Chinese Embassy, the donation was worth 573,700 yuan.
justification: Project involves donation of medical equipment to a hospital, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical equipment donation including ECG monitors, ultrasound systems, and diagnostic instruments
